result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E Brzezinski

defendant.name: Brzezinski, Michael E
defendant.address: 4190 South Regal Drive, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael E Brzezinski appeared by video.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Michael E Brzezinski.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference. Attorney Yasin has recently been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael E Brzezinski appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Drug testing.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael E Brzezinski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Michael E Brzezinski.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Michael E Brzezinski not in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-28-2022 @2p

Defendant Michael E Brzezinski not in court, defendant in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 06-03-2022. Defendant is in custody at CJF. Needs to be produced for court.
Defendant is in custody. Email sent to the Intake Coordinator to schedule Defendant in In Custody Court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/03/2022@2p
